Requirements.Name: Introductory Provisions
Requirements.Description: The New York State Department of Financial Services (DFS) mandates that all regulated entities adopt robust cybersecurity programs to protect against growing threats from cybercriminals. These regulations require companies to assess their specific risks, ensure the safety and soundness of their systems, protect customer information, and have senior management responsible for compliance, including filing annual certifications.

Requirements.Name: Affiliate Definition
Requirements.Description: Affiliate means any person that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with another person. For purposes of this subdivision, control means the possession, direct or indirect, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a person, whether through the ownership of stock of such person or otherwise.

Requirements.Name: Authorized User Definition
Requirements.Description: An Authorized User refers to any employee, contractor, agent, or other person involved in the business operations of a covered entity who is permitted to access and use the entity's information systems and data.

Requirements.Name: CISO Definition
Requirements.Description: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), or CISO, is a qualified individual tasked with supervising and executing a covered entity's cybersecurity program and ensuring compliance with its cybersecurity policy.

Requirements.Name: Class A Company Definition
Requirements.Description: A Class A company refers to a covered entity that has generated at least $20,000,000 in gross annual revenue in each of the last two fiscal years from all business operations, including those of its affiliates. Additionally, it must meet one of the following criteria: (1) have over 2,000 employees averaged over the last two fiscal years, including employees of both the covered entity and all of its affiliates regardless of location; or (2) have over $1,000,000,000 in gross annual revenue in each of the last two fiscal years from all business operations of the covered entity and all of its affiliates regardless of location. When calculating the number of employees and gross annual revenue, affiliates are considered only if they share information systems, cybersecurity resources, or all or any part of a cybersecurity program with the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Covered Entity Definition
Requirements.Description: A Covered Entity refers to any individual or organization operating under or mandated to operate under a license, registration, charter, certificate, permit, accreditation, or similar authorization pursuant to the Banking Law, the Insurance Law, or the Financial Services Law. This definition applies irrespective of whether the covered entity is additionally regulated by other governmental bodies.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Event Definition
Requirements.Description: A Cybersecurity Event encompasses any act or attempt, whether successful or unsuccessful, to gain unauthorized access to, disrupt, or misuse an information system or the information stored within it.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Incident Definition
Requirements.Description: A Cybersecurity Incident refers to a cybersecurity event that occurs at the covered entity, its affiliates, or a third-party service provider under the following circumstances: (1) It impacts the covered entity and necessitates notification to any government body, self-regulatory agency, or supervisory body; (2) It has a reasonable likelihood of significantly harming any material aspect of the covered entity's normal operations; or (3) It results in the deployment of ransomware within a material part of the covered entityâ€™s information systems.

Requirements.Name: Independent audit Definition
Requirements.Description: Independent audit Independent audit means an audit conducted by internal or external auditors free to make decisions not influenced by the covered entity being audited or by its owners, managers or employees

Requirements.Name: Information System Definition
Requirements.Description: An Information System refers to a distinct set of electronic information resources structured for the collection, processing, maintenance, utilization, sharing, distribution, or disposal of electronic information. This also includes specialized systems such as industrial/process controls systems, telephone switching and private branch exchange systems, and environmental control systems.

Requirements.Name: Multi-factor Authentication Definition
Requirements.Description: Multi-factor authentication refers to authentication achieved by verifying at least two of the following types of authentication factors: (1) knowledge factors, such as a password; (2) possession factors, such as a token; or (3) inherence factors, such as a biometric characteristic.

Requirements.Name: Nonpublic Information Definition
Requirements.Description: Nonpublic information encompasses all electronic information not publicly available and includes the following categories: (1) Business-related information of a covered entity, tampering with or unauthorized access to which would cause a material adverse impact on the business, operations, or security of the covered entity; (2) Personal information, such as name, social security number, driver's license number, account numbers, passwords, or biometric records, that can identify an individual; (3) Health-related information created by or derived from a healthcare provider or individual, covering physical, mental, or behavioral health conditions, healthcare provision, or payment for healthcare services, excluding age or gender.

Requirements.Name: Penetration Testing Definition
Requirements.Description: Penetration testing involves testing the security of information systems by attempting to circumvent or defeat the security features of an information system. This is achieved by authorizing attempted penetration of databases or controls from outside or inside the covered entityâ€™s information systems.

Requirements.Name: Person Definition
Requirements.Description: Person refers to any individual or entity, encompassing but not limited to partnerships, corporations, branches, agencies, or associations.

Requirements.Name: Privileged Account Definition
Requirements.Description: A privileged account refers to any authorized user account or service account capable of executing security-relevant functions beyond the scope of ordinary user accounts. These functions include, but are not limited to, the ability to add, modify, or delete other accounts, as well as making configuration changes to information systems.

Requirements.Name: Publicly Available Information Definition
Requirements.Description: Publicly available information encompasses any information that a covered entity reasonably believes is lawfully accessible to the general public. This includes information sourced from Federal, State, or local government records, widely distributed media, or disclosures mandated by Federal, State, or local law. A covered entity's reasonable belief in the lawfulness of public availability requires confirmation that the information falls within the public domain type and confirmation that no individual has directed to restrict its accessibility.

Requirements.Name: Risk Assessment Definition
Requirements.Description: Risk assessment encompasses the process of identifying, estimating, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, and reputation), organizational assets, individuals, customers, consumers, other organizations, and critical infrastructure resulting from the operation of an information system. Risk assessments integrate threat and vulnerability analyses and consider mitigations provided by security controls planned or already in place.

Requirements.Name: Senior Governing Body Definition
Requirements.Description: The senior governing body refers to the board of directors (or an appropriate committee thereof), or an equivalent governing body, or if neither of those entities exist, the senior officer or officers of a covered entity responsible for the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity program. In cases where a cybersecurity program or a part of it is adopted from an affiliate under section 500.2(d) of this Part, the senior governing body may be that of the affiliate.

Requirements.Name: Senior Officer(s) Definition
Requirements.Description: Senior officer(s) refers to the senior individual or individuals (acting collectively or as a committee) responsible for the management, operations, security, information systems, compliance, and/or risk of a covered entity, including a branch or agency of a foreign banking organization subject to this Part.

Requirements.Name: Third-party Service Provider(s) Definition
Requirements.Description: Third-party service provider(s) refers to a person that: (1) is not an affiliate of the covered entity; (2) is not a governmental entity; (3) provides services to the covered entity; and (4) maintains, processes, or otherwise is permitted access to nonpublic information through its provision of services to the covered entity.
Maintain a cybersecurity program. CIA triad
Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity
Risk Identification and Assessment
Requirements.Description: The covered entity must identify and assess both internal and external cybersecurity risks that pose threats to the security or integrity of nonpublic information stored on its information systems.

The covered entity must utilize defensive infrastructure and implement policies and procedures to safeguard its information systems and protect nonpublic information stored on those systems from unauthorized access, use, or other malicious acts
Requirements.Name: Defensive Infrastructure and Policy Implementation
Cybersecurity Event Detection
Requirements.Description: The covered entity must implement measures to detect cybersecurity events effectively.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Event Response
Requirements.Description: The covered entity must have procedures in place to respond promptly to identified or detected cybersecurity events to minimize their impact.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Event Recovery
Requirements.Description: The covered entity must establish procedures for recovering from cybersecurity events and restoring normal operations and services.

Requirements.Name: Regulatory Reporting Obligations
Requirements.Description: The covered entity must fulfill all applicable regulatory reporting obligations related to cybersecurity events.

Requirements.Name: Independent Audits for Class A Companies
Requirements.Description: Each Class A company is required to design and conduct independent audits of its cybersecurity program based on its risk assessment.

Requirements.Name: Adoption of Affiliate's Cybersecurity Program
Requirements.Description: A covered entity may fulfill the requirement(s) of this Part by adopting the relevant and applicable provisions of a cybersecurity program maintained by an affiliate, provided that such provisions satisfy the requirements of this Part, as applicable to the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Availability of Cybersecurity Program Documentation
Requirements.Description: All documentation and information relevant to the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity program, including the relevant and applicable provisions of a cybersecurity program maintained by an affiliate and adopted by the covered entity, shall be made available to the superintendent upon request.

Requirements.Name: Incident Response and Business Continuity Management
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must establish and maintain an incident response, business continuity, and disaster recovery (BCDR) plan. This includes creating comprehensive plans for addressing various cybersecurity events, identifying essential documents and personnel, ensuring timely communication and recovery procedures, conducting regular training and testing, and maintaining secure backups.

Requirements.Name: Operational Resilience
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must establish written plans as part of its cybersecurity program, including proactive measures to investigate and mitigate cybersecurity events, and ensure operational resilience through incident response, business continuity, and disaster recovery plans.

Requirements.Name: Incident Plan
Requirements.Description: Incident response plans must be designed to enable prompt response to and recovery from cybersecurity events affecting the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of the covered entityâ€™s information systems or business operations. These plans should address various types of cybersecurity events, including disruptive incidents like ransomware.

Requirements.Name: Response Goals
Requirements.Description: The goals of the incident response plan.

Requirements.Name: Internal Processes
Requirements.Description: The internal processes for responding to a cybersecurity event.

Requirements.Name: Roles Definition
Requirements.Description: The definition of clear roles, responsibilities, and levels of decision-making authority.

Requirements.Name: Communication Sharing
Requirements.Description: External and internal communications and information sharing.

Requirements.Name: Remediation Requirements
Requirements.Description: Identification of requirements for the remediation of any identified weaknesses in information systems and associated controls.

Requirements.Name: Event Documentation
Requirements.Description: Documentation and reporting regarding cybersecurity events and related incident response activities.

Requirements.Name: Backup Recovery
Requirements.Description: Recovery from backups.

Requirements.Name: Root Cause
Requirements.Description: Preparation of root cause analysis that describes how and why the event occurred, what business impact it had, and what will be done to prevent reoccurrence.

Requirements.Name: Plan Updates
Requirements.Description: Updating of incident response plans as necessary.

Requirements.Name: BCDR Plan
Requirements.Description: Business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) plans must be designed to ensure the availability and functionality of the covered entityâ€™s information systems and services, and to protect personnel, assets, and nonpublic information during a cybersecurity-related disruption.

Requirements.Name: Essential Documents
Requirements.Description: Identify documents, data, facilities, infrastructure, services, personnel, and competencies essential to the continued operations of the covered entityâ€™s business.

Requirements.Name: Supervisory Roles
Requirements.Description: Identify the supervisory personnel responsible for implementing each aspect of the BCDR plan.

Requirements.Name: Communication Plan
Requirements.Description: Include a plan to communicate with essential persons in the event of a cybersecurity-related disruption to the operations of the covered entity, including employees, counterparties, regulatory authorities, third-party service providers, disaster recovery specialists, the senior governing body, and any other persons essential to the recovery of documentation and data and the resumption of operations.

Requirements.Name: Recovery Procedures
Requirements.Description: Include procedures for the timely recovery of critical data and information systems and to resume operations as soon as reasonably possible following a cybersecurity-related disruption to normal business activities.

Requirements.Name: Backup Procedures
Requirements.Description: Include procedures for backing up or copying, with sufficient frequency, information essential to the operations of the covered entity and storing such information offsite.

Requirements.Name: Third-Party Identification
Requirements.Description: Identify third parties that are necessary to the continued operations of the covered entityâ€™s information systems.

Requirements.Name: Plan Distribution
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall ensure that current copies of the plans or relevant portions therein are distributed or are otherwise accessible, including during a cybersecurity event, to all employees necessary to implement such plans.

Requirements.Name: Training Implementation
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall provide relevant training to all employees responsible for implementing the plans regarding their roles and responsibilities.

Requirements.Name: Plan Testing
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall periodically, but at a minimum annually, test its:

Requirements.Name: Incident Plan Test
Requirements.Description: Incident response and BCDR plans with all staff and management critical to the response, and shall revise the plan as necessary.

Requirements.Name: Data Restoration
Requirements.Description: Ability to restore its critical data and information systems from backups.

Requirements.Name: Backup Protection
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall maintain backups necessary to restore material operations. The backups shall be adequately protected from unauthorized alterations or destruction.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Incident Reporting
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must notify the superintendent of cybersecurity incidents, provide ongoing updates, submit annual compliance certifications, maintain records supporting these certifications, and report extortion payments.

Requirements.Name: Incident Notice
Requirements.Description: Notice of cybersecurity incident.

Requirements.Name: Superintendent Notification
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must notify the superintendent electronically via the department's website within 72 hours of determining a cybersecurity incident has occurred at the entity, its affiliates, or a third-party service provider.

Requirements.Name: Information Update
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must promptly provide the superintendent with any requested information regarding the incident and continuously update with material changes or newly available information.

Requirements.Name: Compliance Notice
Requirements.Description: Notice of compliance.

Requirements.Name: Annual Submission
Requirements.Description: Annually each covered entity shall submit to the superintendent electronically by April 15.

Requirements.Name: Written Certification
Requirements.Description: A written certification that the covered entity materially complied with the requirements set forth in this Part during the prior calendar year, based on data and documentation sufficient to accurately determine and demonstrate such compliance, including documentation of officers, employees, representatives, outside vendors, and other individuals or entities, as well as other documentation, whether in the form of reports, certifications, schedules, or otherwise.

Requirements.Name: Written Acknowledgment
Requirements.Description: A written acknowledgment that for the prior calendar year, the covered entity did not materially comply with all the requirements of this Part, identifies all sections of this Part that the entity has not materially complied with and describes the nature and extent of such noncompliance, and provides a remediation timeline or confirmation that remediation has been completed.

Requirements.Name: Certification Submission
Requirements.Description: Such certification or acknowledgment shall be submitted electronically in the form set forth on the departmentâ€™s website and shall be signed by the covered entityâ€™s highest-ranking executive and its CISO. If the covered entity does not have a CISO, the certification or acknowledgment shall be signed by the highest-ranking executive and by the senior officer responsible for the cybersecurity program of the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Record Maintenance
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall maintain for examination and inspection by the department upon request all records, schedules, and other documentation and data supporting the certification or acknowledgment for a period of five years, including the identification of all areas, systems, and processes that require or required material improvement, updating or redesign, all remedial efforts undertaken to address such areas, systems, and processes, and remediation plans and timelines for their implementation.

Requirements.Name: Extortion Payment Notice
Requirements.Description: Notice and explanation of extortion payment. Each covered entity, in the event of an extortion payment made in connection with a cybersecurity event involving the covered entity, shall provide the superintendent electronically, in the form set forth on the departmentâ€™s website, with the following:

Requirements.Name: 24-Hour Notice
Requirements.Description: Within 24 hours of the extortion payment, notice of the payment.

Requirements.Name: 30-Day Explanation
Requirements.Description: Within 30 days of the extortion payment, a written description of the reasons payment was necessary, a description of alternatives to payment considered, all diligence performed to find alternatives to payment and all diligence performed to ensure compliance with applicable rules and regulations including those of the Office of Foreign Assets Control.

Requirements.Name: Confidentiality
Requirements.Description: Information provided by a covered entity pursuant to this Part is subject to exemptions from disclosure under the Banking Law, Insurance Law, Financial Services Law, Public Officers Law, or any other applicable State or Federal law.

Requirements.Name: Cubersecurity Exemptions
Requirements.Description: Exemptions

Requirements.Name: Limited Exemption
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity with: (1) fewer than 20 employees and independent contractors of the covered entity and its affiliates; (2) less than $7,500,000 in gross annual revenue in each of the last three fiscal years from all business operations of the covered entity and the business operations in this State of the covered entityâ€™s affiliates; or (3) less than $15,000,000 in year-end total assets, calculated in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, including assets of all affiliates, shall be exempt from the requirements of sections 500.4, 500.5, 500.6, 500.8, 500.10, 500.14(a)(1), (a)(2), and (b), 500.15 and 500.16 of this Part.

Requirements.Name: Program Exemption
Requirements.Description: An employee, agent, wholly owned subsidiary, representative or designee of a covered entity, who is itself a covered entity, is exempt from this Part and need not develop its own cybersecurity program to the extent that the employee, agent, wholly owned subsidiary, representative or designee is covered by the cybersecurity program of the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: System Exemption
Requirements.Description: A covered entity that does not directly or indirectly operate, maintain, utilize, or control any information systems, and that does not, and is not required to, directly or indirectly control, own, access, generate, receive or possess nonpublic information shall be exempt from the requirements of sections 500.2, 500.3, 500.4, 500.5, 500.6, 500.7, 500.8, 500.10, 500.12, 500.14, 500.15 and 500.16 of this Part.

Requirements.Name: Insurance Law Exemption
Requirements.Description: A covered entity under article 70 of the Insurance Law that does not and is not required to directly or indirectly control, own, access, generate, receive or possess nonpublic information other than information relating to its corporate parent company (or affiliates) shall be exempt from the requirements of sections 500.2, 500.3, 500.4, 500.5, 500.6, 500.7, 500.8, 500.10, 500.12, 500.14, 500.15 and 500.16 of this Part.

Requirements.Name: Insurance Broker Exemption
Requirements.Description: An individual insurance broker subject to Insurance Law section 2104 who qualifies for the exemption pursuant to subdivision 500.19(c) of this Part and has not, for any compensation, commission or other thing of value, acted or aided in any manner in soliciting, negotiating or selling any policy or contract or in placing risks or taking out insurance on behalf of another person for at least one year shall be exempt from the requirements of this Part, provided such individuals do not otherwise qualify as a covered entity for purposes of this Part.

Requirements.Name: Notice of Exemption
Requirements.Description: A covered entity that qualifies for any of the above exemptions pursuant to this section shall file electronically a Notice of Exemption in the form set forth on the departmentâ€™s website within 30 days of the determination that the covered entity is exempt.

Requirements.Name: Specific Person Exemption
Requirements.Description: The following persons are exempt from the requirements of this Part, provided such persons do not otherwise qualify as a covered entity for purposes of this Part: persons subject to Insurance Law section 1110; persons subject to Insurance Law section 5904; any accredited reinsurer, certified reinsurer or reciprocal jurisdiction reinsurer that has been so recognized pursuant to 11 NYCRR Part 125; individual insurance agents who are placed in inactive status under Insurance Law section 2103; and individual licensees placed in inactive status under Banking Law section 599-i.

Requirements.Name: Exemption Cessation
Requirements.Description: In the event that a covered entity ceases to qualify for an exemption, such covered entity shall have 180 days from the date that it ceases to so qualify to comply with all applicable requirements of this Part.

Requirements.Name: Enforcement
Requirements.Description: Enforcement of this regulation will be carried out by the superintendent, including penalties for violations, consideration of various factors in assessing penalties, and ensuring compliance with cybersecurity standards.

Requirements.Name: Superintendent Authority
Requirements.Description: This regulation will be enforced by the superintendent pursuant to applicable laws.

Requirements.Name: Violation Criteria
Requirements.Description: A single prohibited act or failure to meet an obligation required by this Part constitutes a violation.

Requirements.Name: Unauthorized Access
Requirements.Description: Failure to prevent unauthorized access due to noncompliance.

Requirements.Name: 24-Hour Violation
Requirements.Description: Material failure to comply for any 24-hour period.

Requirements.Name: Penalty Assessment
Requirements.Description: When assessing penalties for violations, the superintendent will consider various factors.

Requirements.Name: Cooperation Level
Requirements.Description: Extent of cooperation with the superintendent in the investigation.

Requirements.Name: Good Faith Effort
Requirements.Description: The good faith of the entity.

Requirements.Name: Violation Intent
Requirements.Description: Whether the violations resulted from unintentional or inadvertent conduct, recklessness, or deliberate actions.

Requirements.Name: Remedial Actions
Requirements.Description: Whether the violation was a result of failure to remedy previous examination matters requiring attention or failing to adhere to any disciplinary letter, letter of instructions, or similar.

Requirements.Name: Violation History
Requirements.Description: Any history of prior violations.

Requirements.Name: Violation Pattern
Requirements.Description: Whether the violation involved an isolated incident, repeat violations, systemic violations, or a pattern of violations.

Requirements.Name: False Information
Requirements.Description: Whether the covered entity provided false or misleading information.

Requirements.Name: Harm Extent
Requirements.Description: The extent of harm to consumers.

Requirements.Name: Timely Disclosures
Requirements.Description: Whether required, accurate, and timely disclosures were made to affected consumers.

Requirements.Name: Violation Gravity
Requirements.Description: The gravity of the violations.

Requirements.Name: Violation Count
Requirements.Description: The number of violations and the length of time over which they occurred.

Requirements.Name: Governing Body Participation
Requirements.Description: The extent, if any, to which the senior governing body participated therein.

Requirements.Name: Other Penalties
Requirements.Description: Any penalty or sanction imposed by any other regulatory agency.

Requirements.Name: Financial Resources
Requirements.Description: The financial resources, net worth, and annual business volume of the covered entity and its affiliates.

Requirements.Name: Policy Consistency
Requirements.Description: The extent to which the relevant policies and procedures of the company are consistent with nationally recognized cybersecurity frameworks, such as NIST.

Requirements.Name: Public Interest
Requirements.Description: Such other matters as justice and the public interest require.

Requirements.Name: Effective Date
Requirements.Description: This Part will be effective March 1, 2017. Covered entities will be required to annually prepare and submit to the superintendent a certification of compliance with New York State Department of Financial Services Cybersecurity Regulations under section 500.17(b) of this Part commencing February 15, 2018.

Requirements.Name: Amendment Date
Requirements.Description: The second amendment to this Part shall become effective November 1, 2023.

Requirements.Name: Transitional Periods
Requirements.Description: Covered entities have specific transitional periods ranging from 30 days to two years to comply with various sections of this Part, including new requirements from amendments effective on specific dates.

Requirements.Name: Transitional Period
Requirements.Description: Covered entities have 180 days from the effective date of this Part to meet the compliance requirements, unless otherwise specified.

Requirements.Name: Additional Transitional Periods
Requirements.Description: Covered entities have extended transitional periods: one year to comply with specific sections, eighteen months for others, and two years for additional requirements.

Requirements.Name: Second Amendment Compliance
Requirements.Description: Entities have 180 days from the second amendment's effective date to meet the new requirements, unless specified otherwise.

Requirements.Name: Different Transitional Periods
Requirements.Description: Entities have 30 days, one year, 18 months, or two years from the second amendment's effective date to comply with various new requirements.

Requirements.Name: New Requirements Effective Date
Requirements.Description: New requirements in sections 500.19(e)â€“(h), 500.20, 500.21, 500.22, and 500.24 will be effective from November 1, 2023.

Requirements.Name: Severability
Requirements.Description: If a court finds any provision of this Part or its application to any person or situation invalid, the rest of the provisions will remain effective and applicable to other persons or situations.

Requirements.Name: Electronic Filing Exemption
Requirements.Description: Covered entities can request an exemption from electronic filing requirements by submitting a detailed written request to the superintendent at least 30 days before the filing date. The request must include specific information and justification for the exemption. Upon approval, the filer must comply with the superintendentâ€™s instructions for future filings.

Requirements.Name: Electronic Filing Exemption Request
Requirements.Description: A filer required to make an electronic filing or submission may request an exemption by submitting a written request to the superintendent at least 30 days before the intended filing or submission date.

Requirements.Name: Exemption Request Requirements
Requirements.Description: The request must include the filer's license number, specific filing details, reasons for the exemption, and whether it applies to future filings.

Requirements.Name: Filer Information
Requirements.Description: Set forth the filerâ€™s DFS license number, NAIC number, Nationwide Multistate Licensing System number, or institution number.

Requirements.Name: Specific Filing Details
Requirements.Description: Identify the specific filing or submission for which the filer is applying for the exemption.

Requirements.Name: Exemption Basis
Requirements.Description: Specify whether the exemption request is due to undue hardship, impracticality, or good cause, with a detailed explanation.

Requirements.Name: Future Filings
Requirements.Description: Specify whether the exemption request extends to future filings or submissions, in addition to the specific filing or submission identified.

Requirements.Name: Additional Information
Requirements.Description: The filer requesting an exemption shall submit any additional information necessary for the superintendent to evaluate the request upon the superintendentâ€™s request.

Requirements.Name: Exemption Determination
Requirements.Description: The filer will be exempt from the electronic filing requirement upon the superintendentâ€™s written determination, specifying the basis and applicable filings.

Requirements.Name: Filing Submission Form
Requirements.Description: If the superintendent approves an exemption request, the filer shall make a filing or submission in an acceptable form and manner.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Policy
Requirements.Description: Requires covered entities to adopt a written cybersecurity policy setting forth the policies and procedures for protecting information systems and nonpublic information.

Requirements.Name: Information Security
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall implement and maintain policies and procedures for information security, approved at least annually by a senior officer or the covered entityâ€™s senior governing body. These policies and procedures shall be based on the covered entityâ€™s risk assessment and address the protection of its information systems and nonpublic information stored on those information systems.

Requirements.Name: Data Governance, Classification, and Retention
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall establish and maintain policies and procedures for data governance, classification, and retention, which must be approved at least annually by a senior officer or the covered entityâ€™s senior governing body. These policies and procedures should be based on the covered entityâ€™s risk assessment and should address the governance, classification, and retention of nonpublic information stored on its information systems.

Requirements.Name: Asset Inventory, Device Management, and End-of-Life Management
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must establish and maintain policies and procedures for asset inventory, device management, and end-of-life management. These policies and procedures should be approved at least annually by a senior officer or the covered entityâ€™s senior governing body. They should be based on the covered entityâ€™s risk assessment and should address the inventory, management, and disposal of assets and devices used in storing or accessing nonpublic information.

Requirements.Name: Access Controls, Including Remote Access and Identity Management
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must establish and maintain policies and procedures for access controls, including remote access and identity management. These policies and procedures should be approved at least annually by a senior officer or the covered entityâ€™s senior governing body. They should be based on the covered entityâ€™s risk assessment and should address the management of user access to systems, remote access procedures, and identity management practices.

Requirements.Name: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning and Resources
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must develop and maintain policies and procedures for business continuity and disaster recovery planning and resources. These policies and procedures should be approved at least annually by a senior officer or the covered entityâ€™s senior governing body. They should be based on the covered entityâ€™s risk assessment and should address strategies for maintaining essential business functions during and after a disaster or other disruptive event.

Requirements.Name: Systems Operations and Availability Concerns
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must establish and maintain policies and procedures to address systems operations and availability concerns. These policies and procedures should ensure the continuous operation of information systems and the availability of nonpublic information stored on those systems. They should be designed to mitigate risks related to system failures, disruptions, or downtime, and to restore operations as quickly as possible in the event of an incident.

Requirements.Name: Systems and Network Security and Monitoring
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must establish and maintain policies and procedures addressing systems and network security and monitoring. These policies and procedures should ensure the security of information systems and networks, including the monitoring of network traffic and system activities for suspicious or unauthorized behavior.

Requirements.Name: Security Awareness and Training
Requirements.Description: Covered entities are required to establish and maintain policies and procedures for security awareness and training. These policies and procedures should include measures to educate employees about cybersecurity risks, best practices, and the proper handling of nonpublic information.

Requirements.Name: Systems and Application Security, Development, and Quality Assurance
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must implement and maintain policies and procedures to address systems and application security, development, and quality assurance. These policies and procedures should ensure the secure design, development, and testing of systems and applications to protect nonpublic information.

Requirements.Name: Physical Security and Environmental Controls
Requirements.Description: Covered entities are required to establish and maintain policies and procedures to address physical security and environmental controls. These policies and procedures should ensure the protection of physical assets, facilities, and environmental conditions to prevent unauthorized access, damage, or loss of nonpublic information.

Requirements.Name: Customer Data Privacy
Requirements.Description: Covered entities are required to establish and maintain policies and procedures to ensure the privacy and confidentiality of customer data. These policies and procedures should address the collection, use, storage, and sharing of customer data in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.

Requirements.Name: Vendor and Third-Party Service Provider Management
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must establish and maintain policies and procedures for the management of vendors and third-party service providers. This includes assessing the security practices of vendors and ensuring they comply with cybersecurity requirements.

Requirements.Name: Risk Assessment
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must conduct regular risk assessments to identify, evaluate, and prioritize cybersecurity risks to their information systems and nonpublic information. These assessments should incorporate analyses of threats and vulnerabilities and consider mitigations provided by security controls.

Requirements.Name: Incident Response and Notification
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must establish and maintain effective incident response and notification procedures to promptly respond to and mitigate cybersecurity incidents. This includes identifying, containing, eradicating, and recovering from incidents, as well as notifying appropriate parties as required.

Requirements.Name: Vulnerability Management
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must establish and maintain effective vulnerability management processes to identify, assess, prioritize, and remediate security vulnerabilities in their information systems. This includes regularly scanning for vulnerabilities, assessing their impact, and applying appropriate patches and fixes to mitigate risks.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Governance
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must establish and maintain effective cybersecurity governance frameworks to ensure the alignment of cybersecurity strategies with business objectives and regulatory requirements. This includes defining roles and responsibilities, establishing oversight mechanisms, and implementing processes for monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of cybersecurity controls.

Requirements.Name: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must designate a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). The CISO may be employed by the covered entity, one of its affiliates, or a third-party service provider.

Requirements.Name: Retain Responsibility for Compliance
Requirements.Description: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) must retain responsibility for compliance with this Part.

Requirements.Name: Designate Personnel for Third-Party Oversight
Requirements.Description: The covered entity must designate a senior member of its personnel responsible for the direction and oversight of third-party service providers.

Requirements.Name: Requirement for Third-Party Cybersecurity Program
Requirements.Description: The covered entity must require the third-party service provider or affiliate to maintain a cybersecurity program that protects the covered entity in accordance with the requirements outlined in this Part.

Requirements.Name: Annual Report by CISO
Requirements.Description: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of each covered entity is required to submit a written report annually to the senior governing body. This report should detail the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity program, including relevant information to the extent applicable.

Requirements.Name: Confidentiality, Integrity, and Security
Requirements.Description: The CISO's annual report should address the assurance of confidentiality for nonpublic information and the maintenance of integrity and security within the covered entityâ€™s information systems.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Policies and Procedures
Requirements.Description: The CISO's annual report should cover the effectiveness and adherence to the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity policies and procedures.

Requirements.Name: Material Cybersecurity Risks
Requirements.Description: The CISO's annual report should address material cybersecurity risks faced by the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Overall Effectiveness Assessment
Requirements.Description: The CISO's annual report should evaluate the overall effectiveness of the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity program.

Requirements.Name: Material Cybersecurity Events Reporting
Requirements.Description: The CISO's annual report should include an analysis of material cybersecurity events involving the covered entity during the reporting period.

Requirements.Name: Remediation Plans for Material Inadequacies
Requirements.Description: The CISO's annual report should outline plans for remediating material inadequacies identified in the covered entity's cybersecurity program.

Requirements.Name: Timely Reporting of Material Cybersecurity Issues
Requirements.Description: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is responsible for promptly reporting material cybersecurity issues, including significant cybersecurity events and notable changes to the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity program, to the senior governing body or senior officer(s).

Requirements.Name: Oversight of Cybersecurity Risk Management by Senior Governing Body
Requirements.Description: The senior governing body of the covered entity is responsible for exercising oversight of the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity risk management.

Requirements.Name: Sufficient Understanding of Cybersecurity Matters for Oversight
Requirements.Description: The senior governing body of the covered entity should have sufficient understanding of cybersecurity-related matters to effectively exercise oversight, which may involve the use of advisors.

Requirements.Name: Requirement for Executive Management to Develop, Implement, and Maintain Cybersecurity Program
Requirements.Description: The senior governing body of the covered entity should require the covered entityâ€™s executive management or its designees to develop, implement, and maintain the covered entityâ€™s cybersecurity program.

Requirements.Name: Regular Review of Management Reports on Cybersecurity Matters
Requirements.Description: The senior governing body of the covered entity should regularly receive and review management reports about cybersecurity matters.

Requirements.Name: Confirmation of Resource Allocation for Cybersecurity Program
Requirements.Description: The senior governing body should confirm that the covered entity's management has allocated sufficient resources to implement and maintain an effective cybersecurity program.

Requirements.Name: Vulnerability Management
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall, in accordance with its risk assessment, develop and implement written policies and procedures for vulnerability management that are designed to assess and maintain the effectiveness of its cybersecurity program. These policies and procedures shall be designed to ensure that covered entities:

Requirements.Name: Vulnerability Scans
Requirements.Description: Conduct, at a minimum, vulnerability scans.

Requirements.Name: Penetration Testing
Requirements.Description: Conduct penetration testing of their information systems from both inside and outside the information systemsâ€™ boundaries by a qualified internal or external party at least annually.

Requirements.Name: Automated Scans and Manual Review
Requirements.Description: Conduct automated scans of information systems, and a manual review of systems not covered by such scans, for the purpose of discovering, analyzing, and reporting vulnerabilities at a frequency determined by the risk assessment, and promptly after any material system changes.

Requirements.Name: Prompt Notification of New Security Vulnerabilities
Requirements.Description: Ensure that covered entities are promptly informed of new security vulnerabilities by having a monitoring process in place.

Requirements.Name: Remediate vulnerabilities
Requirements.Description: Timely remediate vulnerabilities, giving priority to vulnerabilities based on the risk they pose to the coveredentity

Requirements.Name: Audit Trail
Requirements.Description: Implement an audit trail that is designed to reconstruct material financial transactions and to detect and respond to cybersecurity events that have a reasonable likelihood of materially harming any material part of the normal operations of the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Secure Maintenance of Systems
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall securely maintain systems that, to the extent applicable and based on its risk assessment, are designed to reconstruct material financial transactions and to detect and respond to cybersecurity events.

Requirements.Name: Reconstruction of Financial Transactions
Requirements.Description: Systems maintained by covered entities shall be designed to reconstruct material financial transactions sufficient to support normal operations and obligations of the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Audit Trails for Cybersecurity Event Detection and Response
Requirements.Description: Covered entities shall include audit trails designed to detect and respond to cybersecurity events that have a reasonable likelihood of materially harming any material part of the normal operations of the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Retention Period for Audit Trail Records
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity shall maintain records required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section for not fewer than five years and shall maintain records required by paragraph (a)(2) of this section for not fewer than three years.

Requirements.Name: Access Privileges and Management
Requirements.Description: This section outlines requirements related to access privileges and management to ensure the security of the covered entity's systems and data.

Requirements.Name: Access Privileges
Requirements.Description: As part of its cybersecurity program, based on the covered entityâ€™s risk assessment, each covered entity shall establish and maintain access privileges to ensure appropriate levels of access to its systems and data.

Requirements.Name: Limit User Access Privileges
Requirements.Description: Limit user access privileges to information systems that provide access to nonpublic information to only those necessary to perform the userâ€™s job.

Requirements.Name: Limit Privileged Accounts and Access Functions
Requirements.Description: Limit the number of privileged accounts and limit the access functions of privileged accounts to only those necessary to perform the userâ€™s job.

Requirements.Name: Limit Use of Privileged Accounts
Requirements.Description: Limit the use of privileged accounts to only when performing functions requiring the use of such access.

Requirements.Name: Periodic Review of User Access Privileges
Requirements.Description: Periodically, but at a minimum annually, review all user access privileges and remove or disable accounts and access that are no longer necessary.

Requirements.Name: Secure Configuration of Remote Control Protocols
Requirements.Description: Disable or securely configure all protocols that permit remote control of devices.

Requirements.Name: Prompt Termination of Access Following Departures
Requirements.Description: Promptly terminate access following departures.

Requirements.Name: Password Policy Implementation
Requirements.Description: Implement a written password policy that meets industry standards.

Requirements.Name: Monitoring Privileged Access Activity
Requirements.Description: Implement monitoring of privileged access activity.

Requirements.Name: Implementation of Privileged Access Management Solution
Requirements.Description: Implement a privileged access management solution.

Requirements.Name: Automated Blocking of Commonly Used Passwords
Requirements.Description: Implement an automated method of blocking commonly used passwords for all accounts on information systems owned or controlled by the company. If blocking commonly used passwords is determined to be infeasible, the CISO may approve, in writing at least annually, the use of reasonably equivalent or more secure compensating controls.

Requirements.Name: Application Security
Requirements.Description: Implement measures to ensure the security of applications used within the organization's infrastructure.

Requirements.Name: Application Security - Secure Development Practices
Requirements.Description: Establish written procedures, guidelines, and standards to ensure the use of secure development practices for both in-house developed and externally acquired applications used within the organization's technology environment.

Requirements.Name: Application Security - Review of Secure Development Practices
Requirements.Description: Ensure that all procedures, guidelines, and standards related to secure development practices for applications are reviewed, assessed, and updated as necessary by the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) or a qualified designee at least once a year.

Requirements.Name: Risk Assessment
Requirements.Description: Conduct risk assessments to identify, analyze, and evaluate cybersecurity risks to the covered entity's information systems, and develop appropriate risk management strategies.

Requirements.Name: Periodic Risk Assessment
Requirements.Description: Conduct a periodic risk assessment of the covered entityâ€™s information systems to inform the design of the cybersecurity program as required by this Part. Review and update the risk assessment as reasonably necessary, but at a minimum annually, and whenever a change in the business or technology causes a material change to the covered entityâ€™s cyber risk. Allow for revision of controls to respond to technological developments and evolving threats.

Requirements.Name: Risk Assessment Policies and Procedures
Requirements.Description: Conduct the risk assessment in accordance with written policies and procedures and document the process. The policies and procedures shall include:

Requirements.Name: Criteria for Risk Evaluation and Categorization
Requirements.Description: Establish criteria for the evaluation and categorization of identified cybersecurity risks or threats facing the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Criteria for System Assessment
Requirements.Description: Establish criteria for the assessment of the confidentiality, integrity, security, and availability of the covered entityâ€™s information systems and nonpublic information. This includes evaluating the adequacy of existing controls in the context of identified risks.

Requirements.Name: Mitigation of Identified Risks
Requirements.Description: Establish mitigation and acceptance strategies for identified risks based on the risk assessment and how the cybersecurity program will address the risks.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Personnel and Intelligence
Requirements.Description: Incorporate qualified cybersecurity personnel who understand the scope of risk assessment and countermeasures.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Intelligence
Requirements.Description: An addition to the requirements in section 500.4(a)

Requirements.Name: Qualified Cybersecurity Personnel
Requirements.Description: Employ qualified cybersecurity personnel from the covered entity, its affiliate, or a third-party provider to manage cybersecurity risks and oversee core functions as specified in section 500.2(b)(1)â€“(6).

Requirements.Name: Training of Cybersecurity Personnel
Requirements.Description: Ensure cybersecurity personnel receive updates and training to adequately address relevant cybersecurity risks.

Requirements.Name: Knowledge Maintenance
Requirements.Description: Ensure that key cybersecurity personnel actively stay informed about evolving cybersecurity threats and countermeasures.

Requirements.Name: Third-Party Assistance
Requirements.Description: A covered entity may opt to engage an affiliate or qualified third-party service provider to help meet the requirements of this Part, in accordance with sections 500.4 and 500.11.

Requirements.Name: Third-party Service Provider Security Policy
Requirements.Description: Mandation of covered entities to implement comprehensive cybersecurity policies and procedures for third-party service providers.

Requirements.Name: Security Policies
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must implement written policies and procedures designed to ensure the security of information systems and nonpublic information accessible to or held by third-party service providers.

Requirements.Name: Security Policies
Requirements.Description: Identification and risk assessment of third-party service providers.

Requirements.Name: Compliance Standards
Requirements.Description: Minimum cybersecurity standards that third-party service providers must meet to conduct business with the covered entity.

Requirements.Name: Cyber Evaluation
Requirements.Description: Due diligence procedures for assessing the adequacy of cybersecurity practices of third-party service providers.

Requirements.Name: Cyber Evaluation
Requirements.Description: Regular evaluation of third-party service providers based on their risk level and the ongoing adequacy of their cybersecurity practices.

Requirements.Name: Due Diligence
Requirements.Description: These policies and procedures shall incorporate relevant guidelines for due diligence and/or contractual protections concerning third-party service providers.

Requirements.Name: Access Controls
Requirements.Description: The third-party service providerâ€™s policies and procedures for access controls, including their use of multi-factor authentication as mandated by section 500.12 of this Part, to restrict access to relevant information systems and nonpublic information.

Requirements.Name: Encryption Policies
Requirements.Description: The third-party service provider's policies and procedures for using encryption, as required by section 500.15 of this Part, to protect nonpublic information both in transit and at rest.

Requirements.Name: Impact Alert
Requirements.Description: Notification to the covered entity in case of a cybersecurity event that directly affects the covered entityâ€™s information systems or nonpublic information held by the third-party service provider.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Compliance
Requirements.Description: Assurances regarding the third-party service providerâ€™s cybersecurity policies for protecting the covered entityâ€™s information systems and nonpublic information.

Requirements.Name: Multi-factor Authentication
Requirements.Description: Mandating the use of multi-factor authentication for accessing information systems, third-party applications, and privileged accounts, with exceptions allowed under specific conditions

Requirements.Name: System Access
Requirements.Description: Multi-factor authentication must be used by anyone accessing a covered entity's information systems, except when the entity qualifies for a limited exemption under section 500.19(a)

Requirements.Name: System Access
Requirements.Description: Remote access to the covered entityâ€™s information systems.

Requirements.Name: Third-Party Access
Requirements.Description: Remote access to third-party applications, including cloud-based ones, where nonpublic information is accessible.

Requirements.Name: Privileged Accounts
Requirements.Description: All privileged accounts except service accounts that do not allow interactive login.

Requirements.Name: CISO Approval
Requirements.Description: If the covered entity has a CISO, the CISO can approve in writing the use of equally or more secure compensating controls. These controls must be reviewed periodically, at least annually.

Requirements.Name: Asset Inventory
Requirements.Description: requires covered entities to implement and maintain accurate asset inventories and establish procedures for secure data disposal.

Requirements.Name: Asset Tracking
Requirements.Description: Covered entities must implement a method to track key information for each asset, including the owner, location, classification or sensitivity, support expiration date, and recovery time objectives (this covers sections 500.13.a.1.i to 500.13.a.1.v).

Requirements.Name: Inventory Frequency
Requirements.Description: The frequency required to update and validate the covered entityâ€™s asset inventory.

Requirements.Name: Secure Disposal
Requirements.Description: As part of its cybersecurity program, each covered entity shall include policies and procedures for the secure disposal on a periodic basis of any nonpublic information identified in section 500.1(k)(2)â€“(3) of this Part that is no longer necessary for business operations or for other legitimate business purposes of the covered entity, except where such information is otherwise required to be retained by law or regulation, or where targeted disposal is not reasonably feasible due to the manner in which the information is maintained.

Requirements.Name: Monitoring Training
Requirements.Description: As part of its cybersecurity program, each covered entity shall implement risk-based policies, procedures, and controls designed to monitor the activity of authorized users and detect unauthorized access or tampering with nonpublic information, and implement controls to protect against malicious code, including monitoring and filtering web traffic and email to block malicious content.

Requirements.Name: Cybersecurity Program
Requirements.Description: As part of its cybersecurity program, each covered entity shall do the following

Requirements.Name: Risk Policies
Requirements.Description: Implement risk-based policies, procedures, and controls designed to monitor the activity of authorized users and detect unauthorized access or use of, or tampering with, nonpublic information by such authorized users;

Requirements.Name: Malicious Protection
Requirements.Description: Implement risk-based controls designed to protect against malicious code, including those that monitor and filter web traffic and electronic mail to block malicious content.

Requirements.Name: Awareness Training
Requirements.Description: Provide periodic, but at a minimum annual, cybersecurity awareness training that includes social engineering for all personnel that is updated to reflect risks identified by the covered entity in its risk assessment.

Requirements.Name: Compensating Controls
Requirements.Description: Each class A company shall implement the following, unless the CISO has approved in writing the use of reasonably equivalent or more secure compensating controls.

Requirements.Name: Endpoint Monitoring
Requirements.Description: Implement an endpoint detection and response solution to monitor unusual activities, including lateral movement.

Requirements.Name: Centralized Logging
Requirements.Description: Implement a solution that centralizes logging and security event alerting.

Requirements.Name: Data Encryption
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must implement a written policy requiring industry-standard encryption to protect nonpublic information in transit over external networks and at rest. If encryption at rest is not feasible, alternative compensating controls approved by the CISO must be used, and the effectiveness of these controls must be reviewed annually.

Requirements.Name: Encryption Standards
Requirements.Description: Each covered entity must implement a written policy requiring industry-standard encryption to protect nonpublic information held or transmitted, both in transit over external networks and at rest.

Requirements.Name: Alternative Controls
Requirements.Description: If a covered entity finds that encrypting nonpublic information at rest is infeasible, it may use effective alternative compensating controls, approved in writing by the CISO. The feasibility of encryption and the effectiveness of these controls must be reviewed annually by the CISO.
